channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: LVMH Buys 50% Stake in Jay-Z's Champagne Brand
item.description: Yesterday, business mogul and rapper Jay-Z sold a 50% stake in his champagne brand, Armand de Brignac, to the wine and spirits division of luxury conglomerate LVMH.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 23
item.description: (The New Yorker)   Read: We're living in an age of peak advice. That's a 50% increase from 2019.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Cherokee Nation Requests That Jeep Drop Cherokee Name
item.description: the US auto industry has a long history of using Native American monikers and imagery.  Chief Chuck Hoskin Jr. requested that Jeep stop using his tribe's name on its Cherokee and Grand Cherokee SUVs, which together account for more than 40% of the brand's total sales.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Trump Taxes: Supreme Court Allows Manhattan DA to Subpoena Financial Documents
item.description: Yesterday, the nation's highest court blocked former President Trump from keeping his financial records out of the hands of Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. The details of Vance's investigation into alleged tax, insurance, and bank fraud by the Trump Organization (which includes residential and commercial real estate businesses) haven't been made public.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Spotify Joins the Rest of the Media World in Focusing on International Expansion
item.description: Netflix has invested in international content to differentiate itself in the streaming wars, maintain an upward growth trajectory, and serve something fresh to its American viewers.  Businesses are looking for new eyes and earsSpotify, which has headquarters in Sweden and the US, joins American media companies in recalibrating growth plans to place a larger emphasis on international markets.  "All this untapped music energy and access to our innovative creator tools will help propel artists to new heights," Spotify wrote in a statement. Put another way, a more global user base will help New Music Friday surface the Lupins of the music world.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Spotify Joins the Rest of the Media World in Focusing on International Expansion
item.description: Netflix has invested in international content to differentiate itself in the streaming wars, maintain an upward growth trajectory, and serve something fresh to its American viewers. Put another way, a more global user base will help New Music Friday surface the Lupins of the music world.  Big picture: With Hollywood and NYC churning out cultural hit after cultural hit, the US has historically dominated the music and entertainment industries.  "All this untapped music energy and access to our innovative creator tools will help propel artists to new heights," Spotify wrote in a statement.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: The Week Ahead: February 22
item.description: Let us know if you've got any fun costumes planned. On Thursday, Airbnb and DoorDash will deliver their first earnings reports since going public. Chag sameach to our Jewish readers celebrating Purim Thursday night.  Warren Buffett will release his famous annual shareholder letter on Saturday.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Coinbase, Stripe Valued Above $100B
item.description: As the first US-based crypto exchange to go public, it'll also confer major legitimacy to digital currencies.  First up, CoinbaseAhead of its planned direct listing, investors are valuing Coinbase at $100+ billion, which would make it the biggest US tech listing since Facebook, per Axios.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: February 22
item.description: (New York Times) Read: A financial crisis is heading for the legendary soccer club, Barcelona. For once, though, his tweets went ignored: Both cryptocurrencies hit record highs this weekend.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Some Texans Face Exorbitant Electricity Bills Following Energy Crisis
item.description: Many Texans facing exorbitant charges were customers of power supplier Griddy, whose prices fluctuate with the wholesale energy market.   And Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner said the state of Texas should "bear the responsibility" of paying the egregiously high bills.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Economic Data Points to Positive Economic Recovery
item.description: The growing signs for optimismWhen investors are nervous about what's ahead, they typically buy US Treasury bonds, which sends bond prices higher and yields down.  Still, the latest wave of economic data has some experts hoping that the US is not only on the rebound, but ahead of schedule. Retail sales jumped 5.3% in January, aided by the latest round of stimulus checks. And when he testifies to the Senate and House finance committees this week, Fed Chair Jerome Powell is expected to continue pressing for more action.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: It is Snowing in Hawaii
item.description: 🤙  + Of course they have: Some locals have swapped their surfboards to snowboards to shred what they’re calling “pineapple powder.”
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Roku Breaks Records In Its Q4 Earnings Report
item.description: As people filled their 2020 voids with CW dramas, Roku’s users streamed 10% more per day in the fourth quarter of 2020 than they did in Q4 2019. It’s now on the lookout for more content to acquire, or even create some original programming of its own.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Covid Vaccine Tracker
item.description: One dose to rule them all: A peer-reviewed study conducted in Israel found that Pfizer’s vaccine is at least 85% effective after the first of two doses. 6.47 million doses are being administered daily, on average. 193 million doses have been administered in 87 different countries.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Marriott CEO Arne Sorenson Passes Away
item.description: The $42 billion company he leaves behind will name a successor by the end of the month.  During his tenure, Marriott's stock rose over 240%. Sorenson also used his position to speak out on issues around immigration and LGBTQ discrimination.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Snowstorm Unexpectedly Freezes Some US Businesses
item.description: A fearsome storm continued to roll through the south and central US yesterday, leaving millions of households without power in bone-chilling temperatures. Some authorities in Texas had to rush doses into people’s arms before they spoiled.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: WTO Appoints Ngozi Okonjo-Iwealea as Director-General
item.description: Yesterday, she was selected as the new WTO director-general. the WTO needs its court running. Okonjo-Iweala wants to reform the WTO to win back respect, promote fair trade, and help with the pandemic recovery. When she starts her 4.5-year term at the WTO next month, she'll be the first woman, African, and (a dual citizen since 2019) American to head the organization.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Mother Nature Unleashes Texas-Sized Storm on the South
item.description: And as huge as Texas is, this storm is bigger than just one state. A winter storm is pummeling the South, leaving millions without power and causing mayhem in the energy market. Texas is a powerhouse for fossil fuels, not renewable energy." But wind power is actually the fastest-growing source of energy in the state's power grid. 3+ million barrels/day in output have been taken offline, more than half of the 5.8 million barrels/day typically produced in the Permian region of Texas and New Mexico.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: L’Oréal Has Strong Q4, Says 2021 Looks Promising
item.description: The next years will “be like the Roaring 20s, there will be a fiesta in makeup and in fragrances,” L’Oréal CEO and Chairman Jean-Paul Agon predicted when discussing the company's results. Well, actually, more like e-commerce in China.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Meet the Air Taxi Startup Going Public via SPAC
item.description: Yesterday, electric aircraft startup Archer said it will SPAC into the public markets in a deal that values it at $3.8 billion. SPACs, or special purpose acquisition companies, have raised more than $38 billion so far this year.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: UAE Satellite Enters Mars Orbit: What It Means
item.description: The nifty science-museum details: From its equatorial orbit, the UAE's satellite will scan the entire surface of Mars every nine days, per mission officials.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Kirkland & Ellis's 2020 Was Reportedly Its Best Year Yet
item.description: If you're on the lookout for more pandemic winners, may we point you to Big Law. The world's highest-grossing law firm, Kirkland & Ellis, is on track to post record annual revenue of ~$5 billion for the 12 months ending in January, according to the Financial Times.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Photos of Vaccination Throughout History
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: How to File Your Taxes as a Sole Proprietor
item.description: First, you’re gonna have to fill out some forms: Income Tax: 1040 (individual income tax return), including a Schedule C (profit or loss from an unincorporated business) Self-Employment Tax: Schedule SE If you have employees, tack on: Estimated Tax: 1040-ESSocial Security, Medicare, and Income Tax Withholding: 941, 943, 944 More Info on Social Security, Medicare, and Income Tax Withholding: W-2, W-3 Federal Unemployment (FUTA) Tax: 940 You may also need to work through issues like information returns (payments to and transactions with non-employees) and excise taxes (taxes paid on certain goods, like gas). A sole proprietorship is the most DIY of all business structures: Legally speaking, there’s no difference between you and your biz.
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.description: (Hawks and Handsaws)  Read: Every superhero movie is a policy failure.

item.title: Vaccine Rollouts Power Uneven Reopening Campaigns Across the World
item.description: Tier 1: Schools will resume on March 8 and outdoor leisure activities like parks, zoos, golf, and tennis may reopen in April. The US is a little all over the placeNYC upped indoor dining capacity to 35% starting next week and California lawmakers have proposed a $6.6 billion plan to reopen elementary schools by April. The badge gives them access to restaurants, events, and other leisure activities.  Tier 2: The UK’s pubs and restaurants will probably have to wait until May or early June for a full reopening.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Brew Crossword: Pet Projects
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Cathie Wood is the Market’s New Oracle
item.description: Can Wood and Ark keep it going?  Zoom out: In January last year, Ark had less than $3.5 billion in total assets; Ark Innovation alone has already attracted $5.3 billion in inflows this year. Ark has added 132,000 more shares across three ETFs since Tesla announced it was investing in bitcoin.    To get a sampling of what sectors Wood is interested in, Ark’s five actively managed ETFs are: 1) Autonomous Technology & Robots2) Next Generation Internet3) Genomic Revolution4) Fintech Innovation5) Innovation, the flagshipEach fund is bursting with companies Ark thinks are developing paradigm-changing technologies. And if you disagree with any of its assessments, Ark publishes the models that support its thinking for free on GitHub. But the rocket fuel to Ark’s rise is a company that spurns traditional fuel altogether: Tesla. Ark Innovation is up 22% year-to-date, while its other four funds are all in the green.
item.author: Toby Howell
